intro: Satureja virgata, commonly known as Turkish thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and square stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are fragrant, containing essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja virgata is often used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.
